meanings.definition: The doctrine that reality is a unified whole and that all existing things can be ascribed to or described by a single concept or system.
meanings.sent1: In his philosophy class, he explained the concept of monisms to his students.
meanings.sent2: The philosopher's book delves deep into the idea of monisms and its implications.
meanings.sent3: The debate club had a fun discussion about monisms and its impact on different worldviews.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork beautifully symbolizes the essence of monisms, portraying unity in diversity.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful visuals to illustrate the concept of monisms to her young students.

meanings.definition: The belief in the existence of only one ultimate substance or principle.
meanings.sent1: Many ancient civilizations held strong beliefs in monisms, attributing all creation to a single source.
meanings.sent2: His faith in monisms guided his actions and decisions throughout his life.
meanings.sent3: The children's storybook humorously depicted a world where monisms ruled supreme.
